alert.note: Alert for Lake; Newton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 10:24AM EST until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Kankakee River at Shelby affecting Lake IN and Newton Counties. For the Kankakee River...including Shelby...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kankakee River from Near I-65 and De Motte downstream to IL/IN state line, including the Shelby gauge. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, IN-55 is threatened south of the river. County Road 1200W/Range Line Road is threatened north of the river. County Road 1150N is threatened at Sumava Resorts. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CST Friday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest just under 12 feet tomorrow evening. River ice spotters indicate that river ice break up has begun near the gauge. Water levels may drop several feet if a downstream ice jam clears quickly. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.9 feet on 01/02/1991. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: River rises are being affected by snow melt from a combination of observed precipitation and warm temperatures. An ice jam is affecting water levels in this area. River forecasts during ice jams are less certain due to many complicated factors. Significant river ice cover can cause large water level fluctuations and flooding with little advanced notice. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 330 AM CST.
